project.teaser: CCAM-ERAS aims to build towards the future and address the transition to connected, cooperative and automated mobility (CCAM) from a socio-economic perspective. The project will develop the necessary knowledge and prepare for the possibilities that potentially will arise from...
project.objective: CCAM-ERAS aims to build towards the future and address the transition to connected, cooperative and automated mobility (CCAM) from a socio-economic perspective. The project will develop the necessary knowledge and prepare for the possibilities that potentially will arise from the deployment of CCAM, and will aim to increase knowledge regarding the necessary skills required for CCAM deployment. CCAM-ERAS will take advantage of the possibilities arising from CCAM deployment, by envisioning a future whereby CCAM can contribute towards a more attractive and inclusive labour market by providing solutions to ensure that the relevant skills are available and are able to be up scaled across the entire CCAM value chain. Mitigating the resulting effects of introduction of CCAM requires multi-sectoral knowledge and cooperation between what were previously separate sectors (transport, technology, education etc.) CCAM-ERAS will develop new approaches and solutions to anticipate and mitigate the impacts and rebound effects on potential job losses and job relocations due to the deployment of road based CCAM systems and services, as well as boost innovation capabilities through the availability and upscaling of CCAM-specific professional skills. Schemes and actions that can contribute to the specific labour market challenges will be developed, in relation to specific 'real world' use cases. CCAM-ERAS will also identify innovations and key innovators relating to CCAM deployment, particularly those relevant to the employment, socio-economic and skills effects Including various stakeholders in the project activities will be crucial in achieving credibility and support for the results of the project. The development of a roadmap to support the socio-economic transition to CCAM will contribute to the legacy of the project. CCAM-ERAS therefore offers a set of building blocks that pave the way for a smooth transition to CCAM deployment over the short, medium, and long term.
project.title: CCAM-Employment Realization through the Acquisition of Skills (CCAM-ERAS)
project.keywords: Labor market, CCAM, economic model, impact assesment network, skills, employment and transport policies, roadmap, innovation radar, stakeholder engagment

article.title: Developing knowledge and skills needed for connected, cooperative and automated mobility deployment

result.title: CCAM-ERAS Community meeting 1 minutes
result.description: This deliverable will be a brief report of the community meeting minutes. It will include the participants and the main outcomes of each meeting. This deliverable belongs to WP2 and is related to Task 2.3

result.title: Report on scenario assumptions and their economic background.
result.description: This report will describe the baseline scenario and the quantitative assumptions made for the development of the scenario. It will also describe the method for developing the scenarios and for data collection. Finally, it will present the scenarios used in model development.

result.title: Website and social networks profiles
result.description: This deliverable is the website where the project, the consortium members and the project results. It also includes the account of the project that will be developed in Twitter and LinkedIn. This deliverable is part of WP7 and Task 7.2

result.title: Progress, financial reports and status reports - I
result.description: These reports will describe the progress of the project in terms of the status of the results and the financial status. The report belongs to WP1 and is linked to Task 1.1. Two reports will be submitted one on M14 and one M26.

result.title: Research Data Management Plan
result.description: These reports will describe the progress of the project in terms of the status of the results and the financial status. The report belongs to WP1 and is linked to Task 1.1. Two reports will be submitted one on M14 and one M26.

result.title: Project Quality Handbook
result.description: This report will describe the measures and procedures to monitor and review the outcome, it will define a risk assessment plan with an evaluation template to track risks and establish GDPR procedures/forms to guarantee protection of personal information.It will be updated with quality reviews in M12 and M24. It belongs to WP1 and is related to Task 1.3

result.title: Report analysing the impact of CCAM on each use case
result.description: This report describes which includes skills and gender mismatches per use case, including a landscape of the current situation of skills and gender balance and the (future) labour market movements and opportunities as a result of CCAM implementation, and a blueprint for schemes and actions and their conditions for success, based on the outcomes of the needs analysis. The deliverable belongs to WP 5 and Tasks 5.1-5.3.

result.title: CCAM-Scan PESTLE Analysis report
result.description: The deliverable described the results of the CCAM- Scan and the PESTLE Analysis. It establishes the basis for analyses of future requirement skills and related labour aspects. It also describes the implications of CCAM on the transport value chain (e.g., physical, and digital infrastructure, vehicles, transport and logistic operations, traffic and transport management and mobility services), society (e.g., land use development, traffic safety and use of resources), and regulation and policy (e.g., regulative framework and collaboration between sectors and authority levels). The deliverable belongs to WP3 and is linked to Task 3.1.

result.title: Stakeholders’ and population groups impact analysis and mapping
result.description: Impact analysis and mapping of the social effects reported for stakeholders and population groups during the engagement activities and a comparison between stakeholders and population groups. This deliverable belongs to WP4 and is related to Task 4.C.1MaaSlan

category.title: innovation management
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/innovation management

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
